title: PE Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: It was good but I didn't get the job . they wasted my time a bit with the organisation of it and there was a change in the date/time a couple of times and it ended up being vis zoom instead of in place
Interview Questions: your vision for the role

title: Careers Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Interview, six people on panel. Head of Service, employer, academic, HR, peers. One interview, a mix of competency and situational questions. Not much else to say. So writing to fill up space here!
Interview Questions: Your friends are at the pub how would they describe you.

title: Gift Shop Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Interview was set up through email, done over zoom. Interview was with mangers of the shop, lasted 15 minutes. Asked various questions about my previous experience Heard back after 3 days give or take. Interviewers were very welcoming
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose to work here
How do you know about us

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: It took a while between the job being advertised to being called for interview, and a long notice period for the interview also.  The application form itself is quite detailed and removes the need to attach a CV.
Interview Questions: How would I be suitable for the role.

title: SU Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: No interview as the role is an elected one. There were hustings where we were questioned by different societies and student newspapers etc. questions were mostly relevant but some were unrelated totally to the role so not a great example
Interview Questions: What’s your stance on gender neutral bathrooms?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: It was such a nice experience for me to be able to take part in the online interview. Questions are not too difficult, which mainly aims at examing your basic programming skills.
Interview Questions: Programming Test (including three questions)

title: Researcher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were done remotely, with two interviewers and there were two rounds to the interview process. There was an application deadline and after the first interview a time was given for communicating if you got through to the next round. Overall the communication was excellent and prompt.
Interview Questions: What things would you do to bring this to an engaging prototype?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: asked questions about my experience,  why I was interviewing, what I wanted to gain. What I liked to do , where I saw myself in future, why I chose them, goals and hobbies
Interview Questions: how are you, why do you want this?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process fo the phd position was mainly introducing myself and talking about the projects I have been working on in the past. After that, they asked me questions about my decision to do a phd, or where do I see myself in a future.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to do a phd?

title: Digital Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: applied online and had an in-person interview two weeks later. The interview was with a two-person panel (my direct line manager and their manager) Which I was successful in and currently work here.
Interview Questions: Technically how can you deal with the transfer and management of a large number of files and maintain organisation.

title: Lead Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Casual conversation with department head, although was recommended by course creator which may have made the process more straightforward. Very friendly and straightforward, mostly just me talking about previous experience and such.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process seems fair. However, it is subject to the field you are applying to. Usually, the requirements outlined are the minimum requirements and you are needed to excel and display both adaqute team work and a gift for independent research.
Interview Questions: Can you summarise (insert a recent paper from the employer) in a concise manner and outline any improvements you would make to the research.

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hard process to ensure they have the right person for the role. Phone interview followed by  panel interview and final presentation interview. Allowed plenty of time you prepare for presentation. Friendly overall
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through HR for the TCD temp pool. My interview with HR was held in the office kitchen, with staff taking their break. 
The Second round interview with the specific School took place in a public walk through with the School building, with staff and students walking past.
Interview Questions: How many years experience do you have

title: Masters' Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was nice and you were briefed about the course and challenges in it. You were then asked about your background and each of the professors would make sure that you did not feel uncomfortable with any of the decisions you make regarding the course.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this course?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: The process took one month. Email with CV and cover letter then a phone interview and finally an on-site interview with all the team. It was easy enough for somebody prepared.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was in depth, started with a phone call and moved on to an in person interview. Overall it was an enjoyable experience, I had no issues with it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last experience with research.

title: Housekeeping Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website (11 steps), then I was welcome to an interview at trinity. I had to bring some documents. After that they put me in a panel list and I waited for 2 months until be called to work.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences, what is your availability to start, Tell me a bit about yourself.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: My friend was working there and referred me. Then I just went for on site interview and they told me that they will let me know. After 3 days they send me the contracts and then I started working after 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years time

title: Communicator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, friendly atmosphere, easy but thought provoking questions. Focused on your experience rather than academia. Was with two people in the cafe, which made it less intimidating. lasted 30-40 minutes
Interview Questions: Why do you think its important for art and science to work together

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Application and a well written cover letter, and two academic references are needed. 
It is always better to apply early. There are no additional interviews, only online submission. Everyone is nice and helpful
Interview Questions: No questions were asked. Language certificate by the end of July the latest

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: There was a 30 minute presentation and a 30-40 minute interview.  At interview there were about 8 people present, including Head of College and Head of School and colleagues at Departmental level. Each colleague asked a question on the panel. The interviewers were friendly and supportive during the interview, but questions were searching.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: You are invited for a group interview after submitting your CV and being accepted through the screening. There are multiple questions posed to the group and it is a very positive experience where everyone is very encouraging.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview by online meeting, due to to bad quality, then switch to phone, quite easy, in my opinion. Then contact by Email to talk about the visa application and contract paperwork.
Interview Questions: Some bask questions related to the research topic

title: Mediator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Application online, followed by email correspondence, followed by in person interview to assess knowledge and ability to perform as a mediator - scientific knowledge/background, ability to speak in public, answer questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have an interest in Science Communication?

title: Network Access Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. The entire process was quite slow. Took a number of weeks before hearing back and then to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview was fairly straightforward, offer came maybe a week later.
Interview Questions: Technical questions related to Wi-Fi and user devices.

title: Mediator, Science Gallery Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Emailed and recieved a link to the online application form. Called for interview a few weeks later, and asked about experience, motivation for applying, whether anyone had referred me.
Interview Questions: Describe your relevant experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed interview with PI, went through academic background and research skills and objectives. Involved presentation of PhD work and description of publications. Also needed to describe my vision for the current position. All in all was fairly easy going and PI had a relaxed friendly demeanor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Visiting Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview, I just submitted my qualifications and my achievements in the form of mail and CV.  A professor liked my qualifications and he hired me with a huge smile and asked when can I start the work?
Interview Questions: When are you available to work?

title: Mediator At Science Gallery Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: A casual conversation in the cafe about why I wanted the job, my knowledge of the science gallery and what parts of mediating I might be worried about or looking forward to.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to get out of working here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended for the position by a previous project supervisor and was offered the position based on that. We discussed the project I would be working on i the interview and when I displayed some competency on the project specifications, the interviewer seemed confident.
Interview Questions: We discussed the project I would be working on.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview + 10 minute Presentation - 5 on the panel including one external interviewer from outside the organisation. Interview started with 10 minute presentation on a topic given in advance. This was followed by a 35-40 min interview. Each member of the panel asked questions and I was given the opportunity to ask questions at the end. Questions were mainly competency based.
Interview Questions: Competency based Interview

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an original phone screen. As the position was for a call centre, they sensibly began by testing your phone manner. You were asked to complete a pretend call using the script provided. After this, there was a group interview with four or five students, conducted by the supervising manager and another manager. It was quite friendly and relaxed.
Interview Questions: What past experience do you feel has prepared you for this?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: This will vary between Professors. Mainly just questions about my past experience and my interest. Discussing the project for a good while. Wasn't expected to have a technical understanding of the work to be done, but to be able to grasp the concepts.
Interview Questions: None really.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Directly contacted various academic staff about availability of funding. I sent an email to one professor who forwarded it to another who seemed interested in my skills.

Organised a meeting to discuss the University and the projects available. I met up with the hiring professor directly and he had a discussion with me about the position he was looking to fill.

Informally spoke about my previous work and what I was looking for in a PhD position.

Was invited to apply for a PhD position and applied online.

The online application was successful and I started within two months of the initial discussion.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience in the field?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was focused on very detailed technical issues in my research area. The interview board was composed of 5 more lecturers from the department and the chair was my mentor-to-be. The atmosphere was very warm and comfortable and the result was out within one day after the interview.
Interview Questions: What would I do if I cannot get the expected result of the research project given the limited time?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview- specific questions about the related discipline. General questions about chemistry, certain named reactions and a few easy mechanisms. They asked about my undergraduate degree, what subjects I enjoyed and didnt enjoy. Why i was choosing a PhD in this field and what I knew about the disease area so far.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to continue a career in reasearch

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Initial email contact with a professor asking about available PhD positions
Replied with project details and followed up with Skype interview.
After successful completion of the interview was invited to the campus to meet and have a look around before finalising the decision.
Interview Questions: What previous research I'd been involved with, why I wanted to work on that particular project.

title: Guest Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: One interview by the course coordinator. This was followed by a review of the lecture syllabus to be presented. Subsequently, the presentations where approved. During exam time, the exam scripts were reviewed and approved.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?
